result.execSummary:
The defendant Ka Chai Khang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Pay Restitution. Bond will be applied to restitutions first. Restitution from dismissed and read-cases 15CF7 $219.98 and 15CF267 $140.11 are included.

Pay costs, surcharges, including DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full time employment. If not employed, have to apply for 5 jobs a week.

No contact with any victims except with a letter of apology, to be written within the first 90 days, to be reviewed by DOC first before forwarding to victims
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not enter into any casinos.
Attend Criminal Thinking Class if not done so.
Attend Financial Management Class if not done so.
Comply with any other counseling as recommended by the agent.
No contact with victims, victims' properties or places of employment.
Any bonds posted in any files are to be applied to restitution first, then fine/costs/surcharges. 
Submit DNA Sample.
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration, but not until 32 months of confinement have elapsed.
Not eligible for earned release program.
Attend Mental Health and Psychologial assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations if not done so.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Ka Chai Khang in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Defendant Ka Chai Khang in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-425, 15CF-263, 15CF-266, 15CF-265, and 15CF-264. 

9:35 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

This is the continuation of a sentencing hearing. PSI was not completed timely so matter was continued for Defense to go over PSI with her client.

Atty Kessler has read the PSI with her client.
The Court this morning received another PSI, an amended PSI. Court has not read it, it is another 31 pages.

P&P Agent Morrow addresses the Court regarding a new PSI. The PSI came out of the Shawano office.
P&P Agent Angela Zingsheim addresses the Court, is from the Shawano office.
Agent Zingsheim explains the differences between the two.  
Discussions continue.

Atty Kessler is prepared to proceed today, will call a witness.
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, there are victims present but do not want to make any further statements.
Atty Knaapen provides restitution summaries, that relate to the dismissed & read in files, to the Court.
Atty Knaapen provides victim impact statements and restitution summaries on other files, to the Court.

9:43 AM Court will take a moment to read the statements and summaries.

9:46 AM Angela Zingsheim is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Kessler.

10:17 AM Jenny Khang is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Kessler.
10:23 AM Cross-examination by Atty Knaapen.
10:24 AM Examination by the Court.

Atty Knaapen states the victims do not want to make an oral statement today.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, Atty Kessler was requesting some intervention, does not know how to proceed.

Atty Kessler addresses the Court as to the intervention matter, was able to supplement the PSI with the testimony. 
Court will not follow the recommendations, is not close to the way anyone else was ever treated here. Court is to be fair and impose the least amt of confinement consistent to factors.  Recommendations are way out of bounds, is not rational in terms of final conclusions.  It does not mean a prison sentence is not warranted though, but it will not be 21 years. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing recommendations, not in terms of a specific sentence, but believes a prison sentence is warranted. 
Court replies.

Atty Kessler makes sentencing recommendations, believes probation is appropriate with county jail time and counseling.

10:55 AM Court questions child protective services worker who is present, regarding the children. Children are currently placed in 3 different homes of the father. There are injuries but could not pinpoint the cause of the injuries.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

14CF-425
Ct 1: 
Determinate Prison Sentence for 3 years
Initial Confinement of 1.5 years
Extended Supervision of 1.5 years
Concurrent to all other sentences
Eligible for challenge incarceration  but not until 32 months of confinement have elapsed
Not eligible for earned release program
Conditions:
Pay Restitution:
K.C. for $222.50
Kohls for $219.98
Copps for $140.87
M.P. for $70
BMO Harris for $500
Best Buy for $140.11
D.& P. H. for $820
R.& J. Z. for $801.81
Security Health Plan for $124.88
N.S. for $45 unless updated
25% prison account for fines/costs/restitution
No contact with any victims except with a letter of apology, to be written within the first 90 days, to be reviewed by DOC first before forwarding to victims
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not enter into any casinos
Obtain and maintain full time employment. If not employed, have to apply for 5 jobs a week
Attend Criminal Thinking Class if not done so
Attend Financial Management Class if not done so
Attend Mental Health and Psychologial assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations if not done so
Comply with any other counseling as recommended by the agent
No contact with victims, victims' properties or places of employment
Any bonds posted in any files are to be applied to restitution first, then fine/costs/surcharges. There is $2,700 posted, go to restitution first
Pay costs
Submit DNA Sample
Pay DNA Surcharge

15CF-263
Ct 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 10 years
Initial Confinement of 3.5 years
Extended Supervision of 6.5 years
Concurrent with all other cases
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 14CF-425
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Ct 6:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 10 years
Initial Confinement of 3.5 years
Extended Supervision of 6.5 years
Concurrent to all other sentences
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Ct 1 and 14CF-425
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

15CF-264
Ct 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 7 years
Initial Confinement of 3 years 
Extended Supervision of 4 years 
Concurrent to all other sentences 
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 14CF-425 and 15CF-263
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

15CF-265
Ct 1:
Jail sentence for 6 months
Concurrent to all other sentences
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Ct 5:
Jail sentence for 6 months
Concurrent to all other sentences
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

15CF-266
Ct 2:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 3 years
Initial Confinement of 1.5 years 
Extended Supervision of 1.5 years
Concurrent to all other sentences
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 14CF-425, 15CF-263 and 15CF-264
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Written explanation of determinate sentencing has been filled out and copies are to be provided to parties
Boot camp is addressed
Atty Kessler addresses the Court regarding jail credit, provided a color coded list.
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court regarding jail credit.
Atty Kessler replies, received the dates from the jail to determine credit, as well as when bond was posted.

Parties continue discussions on jail credit.

BY THE COURT:
216 Day credit against prison sentences 

Parties will keep their copies of the PSI.
Written explanation is passed out.
20 days in which to appeal. 

11:40 AM Court is in recess.
Sentencing hearing on June 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.

5/27/16 Bond amended to $5,000 cash. 
This bond covers all files: 14CF425, 15CF263, 15CF264, 15CF265, 15CF266
Cash previously posted on other files is to be applied to this bond.  (Total previously posted is $2,700.00)

Conditions previously ordered: 
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Patricia & Daniel Holland or their residence. Roger & Julie Zebro or their residence.
No contact with Shopko store in Plover, Wisconsin.  Comply with all conditions of other pending cases.

Defendant not in court.  Attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF425,15CF263, 15CF264, 15CF265, 15CF266

9:15 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Court and both counsel have received a copy of the PSI. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Kessler received the PSI this morning and has not had a chance to go over that with the defendant.  Makes additional statements to the Court. 

Court will continue the matter for the reasons stated on the record.  

Court addresses bond. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kessler makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kessler makes additional arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond is raised to a total of $5,000 cash to be posted.  Bond now covers all files before the court.    
Clerk informs the court that a total of $2,700 has been posted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 05-27-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Ka Chai Khang in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-153, 15CF-265, 15CF-264, 15CF-263, 15CF-267, 14CF-425, 15CF-7 and 15CF-266.

9:40 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances. 

Matter is set for a plea hearing.

There is an agreement.
14CF-425: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 and Count 3 would be dismissed and read in
Parties are anticipating a PSI. Both sides would be free to argue.
15CF-263: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 6. Counts 2-5 and 7-10 would be dismissed and read in
15CF-264: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Counts 2-5 would be dismissed and read in
15CF-265: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 5. Counts 2-4 and 6-12 would be dismissed and read in
15CF-266: Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 and 3-6 would be dismissed and read in
15CF-7, 15CF-153 and 15CF-267 would be dismissed and read in

Atty Kessler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed for each file.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF-425: Count 1: NO CONTEST
15CF-263: Count 1: NO CONTEST
15CF-263: Count 6: NO CONTEST
15CF-264: Count 1: NO CONTEST
15CF-265: Count 1: NO CONTEST
15CF-265: Count 5: NO CONTEST
15CF-266: Count 2: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kessler  for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-425: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
14CF-425: Counts 2-3: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-263: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-263: Count 6: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-263: Counts 2-5 and Counts 7-10: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-264: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-264: Counts 2-5: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-265: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-265: Count 5: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-265: Counts 2-4 and Counts 6-12: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-266: Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-266: Count 1 and Counts 3-6: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-7: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-153: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-267: Dismissed and Read In


BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI. 

Sentencing hearing will be May 27, 2016 at 9:00 AM for 1 hour.

BY THE COURT:
PSI to be completed by May 13, 2016.
Copies to be forwarded to counsel.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant has new address in Wisconsin Rapids.

Atty Knaapen reviews his files and makes a statement.
Court states the status of the cases for the defendant.
